chapter.name: Delicious Tutorials: Karplus Strong
chapter.indexinfo: Modeling a plucked string in Max
chapter.p: The Karplus Strong algorithm is old. Almost as old as FM synthesis, the Karplus-Strong algorithm dates back to a paper written by Kevin Karplus and Alex Strong in 1983, called "Digital Synthesis of Plucked String and Drum Timbres". The idea is, you imagine a string as a combination of an excitation and a simple resonant filter. The excitation is noisy, containing energy at all frequencies. For a resonant filter, the algorithm uses a simple delay line. Frequencies passing through the delay line will interfere destructively with copies of themselves, unless the period of a frequency is the same as the length of the delay line.
